ETYMOLOGY: From Old English þīef, þēof (akin to Old Frisian thiaf, Old Saxon thiof, Old High German diob, Old Norse þjófr), from Proto-Germanic *þeubaz, from Proto-Indo-European *teup- ('to hide').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who steals, especially secretly or without open force.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The thief managed to slip out of the store unnoticed with a bag full of goods.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 小偷带着一袋子货物，设法悄无声息地溜出了商店。
